statement.p: How many loads of gravel will be needed to cover 1.5 miles of roadbed, 36 feet wide, to a depth of 3.5 inches, if one truckload contains 7.1 {yd}^{3} of gravel?
Find the volume of gravel needed, rounded to the nearest cubic foot.
Convert that volume to cubic yards.
Finally, how many truckloads? Think about appropriate rounding. Recall that one truckload contains 7.1 {yd}^{3} of gravel.
